reviews.sentence: Truly Five Star Hotel and Service ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ I confirmed my booking over the phone the night before we checked in on 1302 the lady who answered was courteous at first but was rude and impatient in the end when we were asking questions about early check in so before checking in we were a bit hesitant that service would be crap. I honestly did not expect much after that we were told that 3 pm was check in and that they would allow early check in will be allowed if available. My husband after checking out of the other hotel at 10 pm will be waiting for 5 hrs i was training in our office so i would not be able to accompany him. So he got in at 130 and got an early check in. I was super relieved checking in according to him was a breeze. We got a city view room with big windows looking out to centre point tower we were delighted at least we still got a view the room was classic luxury. Black marble bathroom faultless and clean. Tasteful decors and fursnishings high quality duvet awesome smelling room aircon was quiet i did nt think it was working when i turned it on automatic blackout shutters. I briefly worked in four seasons and i know what to inspect in 5 star luxury rooms this just scored 100 perfect. Let us talk about the facilities Classic grand entrance lovely sitting areas reception awesome tea room with lovely cakes petit fours etc business centre with touch screen lenovo units and it the lobby smells like versace perfume there s a versace store in the lobby it looks and felt like lux the bar was also looking quite cool with a big atrium looking glass overlooking Hyde park gym fully equipped the spa looks amazing the pool so perfect on the rooftop very inviting with the view of the park and St Marys Chapel it was awesome. Now about the service in the hotel. I wanted to see the pool around 11 pm and we could nt locate it asked reception who courteously advised that we needed to take the far right elevators level 22 but advised pool closes at 9 pm he called somebody to take us up to open the elevator again and took us at the 22nd floor the pool area door was closed up but he went to all that effort to show us. when we were done we went down to the lobby again and sat down the same reception guy saw me again and asked if we were taken up to the pool that was a follow up. My ears were clapping. ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ ⭐ ️ Five star. The morning of check out i had a hard time getting my husband out of bed he loved the bed he wanted to stay but valentines day is quite pricey so i did nt opt to stay longer So we went to concierge and I asked Mike if were supposed to check out earlier than advised You see Dusit Thani Manila locked us out of our room 30minutes prior advised check out. so i was traumatized. He said that check out time is really 11 pm but we can elave our bags there no time limit to still explore the city. Omigodnes. I was so happy we got extended time to explore. My husband and I were very thankful to Mike mentioning this to us. So I decided to sign up for Spg My husband who hates signing up for memberships to avoid publicly flaunting confidential information was so happy he wanted me to join. All I can say to this Sheraton staff is thank you for the wonderful Valentine. ❤ ️ ❤ ️ ❤ ️ We will be back ✌ ️.

Internet charges. The shearton is in a great location on Hyde park. This was our third stay in Sydney and were really shocked to see that this hotel charges guests for internet use at 20 per day. The crazy thing is if you are not a guest and simple sit in the lobby you are provided with a free internet password. So best just do not check in and internet is free. Nowadays most hotels do not chatge for internet as it is a utility and required by everybody. I spoke to the duty manager and his reply was just pay it everbody else charges so we do too. Just a total rip off for guests. On previous visits to Sydney we stayed at 4 seasons and the W hotel on both occasions we paid no internet charges. We will not be staying here again.

Do nt just do nt. I came here for a conference. Arrived 1 pm and no rooms available pity but ok offered to buy an upgrade which I took. Room was very noisy from outside windows thin corridor and adjacent rooms thankfully no late night nooky next door. Property is on the edge of needing a renovation and water temperature was highly variable. wifi so terrible that I used my phone. Bed was very good and sheets lovely. Alas it ended there. Service was terrible on most fronts. From the numerous pointless intrusions lack of pick up of laundry service for 5 hours after 3 requests failure to clean more like placement of a hairball in my sink no replacement of amenities etc etc. Room service was outrageously expensive for a very unimaginative meal. If this is supposed to be a 5 star it is not on so many levels. For what they are charging it is very poor and there are plenty of other options that are actually 5 star. Alas similar experiences from my conference colleagues it was one of the major talking points at coffee breaks. and I do nt think that the organisers will be using this hotel again.

Great staff in Lounge and Checkin Staff. Upgraded suite was very comfortable facing Park View. Good Platinum recognition. The club level on the 21 floor is excellent with great staff. If you are not Platinum member I would recommend paying the extra to upgrade. Breakfast was almost the same as Buffet downstairs. The evening drinks and canape service was more than enough for a light meal. The food was of exceptional quality. I look forward to returning back.

Sublime. What a fantastic place to stay everyone was willing to help us from the time we want to check in and tried their best to ensure that we had the best enjoyable time in Sydney. Going to stay in Sydney is the place to be. We were here on a Conference and every evening we attended a function were always asked on our return how our evening was. Reception staff were always on hand to help with more than a couple of minutes delay in getting served.

Fantastic gem centrally located. Stayed on Friday night and I had forgotten how wonderful the hotel is. I arrived with my baby several hours before check in. Thought I could drop bags and walk around the city. However the check in staff were wonderful and found me a room that was available without me even asking. They were really personable and interested in my baby. The valet staff even helped me in and out with my stroller and helped pack the car for me. During our stay the room was very roomy and comfortable. We had access to the club lounge which was very nice. Great food and service with a smile. Just did not have enough time to check out the pool and gym. Will have to come back for another visit. Highly recommend for families.

Good. I dropped my wallet outside my room and a hotel staff member found it and it was promptly returned before I realised it was missing. I was so shocked I did not give the gentleman a tip for his honesty. I did leave 20 the next day for him when I was checking out and I hope he received it. Checking in took forever as I was staying 2 nights that had been booked separately. I was finally given a room and was disappointed that my city room was a disabled room looking at a brick wall. I do think that you should give a guest the option of a disabled room as the facilities are not the same. I also expected a king size or twin doubles but not single beds. I arrived about 930 pm on a cold night and my room was set at 17 degrees air conditioning. the room was simply freezing.

Sydney Sheraton is the worst of my five star hotels 1 our room breakfast is a separate charge 44 dollars a person we 5 people is 20 dollars. Then inside the vegetables we suspect that the cook did not clean eat a few broccoli which have sand This is not a street shop Oh is a five star hotel 2 there is a call out of the vegetables chefs do not want to cut directly one by one on the plate inside the not the kind of lettuce is not used to vegetables vegetables. 3 cook a bowl of noodles super ugly I swear. only soy sauce taste 4 the whole breakfast of the food variety is very simple the food is not generally less and even can be said that some of the four star hotel. Holding the plate can not find the food you want to eat 5 there is no chef in the field cut the kind of ham only baked and baked black coke that kind of bacon 6 the bathtub is relatively small bath the boss may save water bar 7 we live in a large bed room towels only 2 usually five star hotel is equipped with four bath towel ❗ 8 want to go to the gym the results of four elevators inside three elevators can not directly reach the gym the key is inside the elevator there is no one tips three elevators can not directly reach the gym it is estimated that the boss to save development costs or Do not want the guests to use the gym at all 9 Wi Fi charges the lobby of the public areas are also charged the room will have to charge this boss is more love money ah ❗ 10 the parking lot to be charged. This understanding. In short it will not be admitted to Sydneys Sheraton悉尼Sheraton是我住过的五星级酒店里面最差的一家酒店了 ❗ 1，我们的房间早餐是单独收费的，4块钱一个人，我们5个人就是20块钱 ……. 然后，里面的蔬菜我们怀疑厨师根本就没有清洗，吃了几个西兰花里面都有沙子 ❗ 沙子 ❗ 这不是路边小店哦，是五星级酒店 ❗ 2，有一种叫不出来的蔬菜，厨师连切都不愿意，直接一匹一匹的放在盘子里面 ❗ （ 不是生菜那种）也不是拿来包菜的蔬菜 。. 3，煮了一碗面，超级难吃，我发誓，只有酱油味 ❗ ❗ ❗ 4，整个早餐的食物品种非常单一，食物不是一般的少，甚至可以说还不如一些四星酒店！（拿着盘子找不到自己想要吃的食物 ） 5，里面没有厨师在现场切的那种火腿，只有烤了又烤的，黑的，焦的那种培根 ❗ 6，洗澡的浴缸比较小，可能老板节约用水吧 ❗ 7，我们住的是大床房间，浴巾只有2张，通常五星级酒店是配置了4张浴巾 ❗ 8，想去健身房，结果4部电梯里面，三部电梯是不可以直接到达健身房的，关键是电梯里面外面也没有一个提示 ❗ （ 三部电梯无法直接到达健身房，估计老板节约开发成本吧，或者根本就不想要客人去使用健身房 ） ❗ 9，Wi Fi收费，大堂公共区域也收费，房间更要收费，这老板是多爱钱啊 ❗ 10，停车场更要收费了。（这个理解 ） 总之就是差评，以后不会入住悉尼的Sheraton啦 ❗ ❗ ❗.

Elegant hotel in a great location. I have stayed at this hotel a few times now and the service is always friendly the rooms are quite spacious with an elegant feel. If you pay for a room on the front then the views are delightful over Hyde Park rooms at the back are much less delightful. The pricing for room service and mini bar are astronomical and if you are an SPG elite I would not expect much I am yet to receive a room upgrade yet I was offered one at a charge. early check in has never been possible and the hotel does not seem to have enhanced amenities. Despite that it is a solid hotel with friendly staff and a great location.

Welcoming and professional. It was my first time staying at Sheraton and it was perfection. The location is ideal and the facilities are incredible and the staff particularly the Sheraton Club Team Lachie Nina and Kelly were always so helpful friendly and respectful and made my stay far more welcoming and comfortable. Will be returning.

More like a St Regis than a Sheraton. Beautiful room and facilities. Fabulous club lounge we ate all our meals here. But the best was the staff. From check in to the lounge Kelly in particular everyone was amazing they all went out of their way to make us happy over and over again. Also a great location very central.
Absolutely beautiful stay. Amazing four day trip with brilliant accommodation and befet breakie.
Wonderful. Room was spacious clean and well maintained. Love the pool and spa facilities. Location is very central. Nothing.

Great weekend break. Really great service and a fantastic room overlooking the park and St Marys Cathedral. The room was nicely appointed and very clean with good amenities. It was particularly quite and very close to shops bars and restaurants.
very close to the city centre with excellent location. Stay for 1 night and got a room that face to the Hyde Park. Nice sunshine when in sunrise. Room are spacious with modern facilities.

My stay at the Sheraton Grand Sydney remided me of what 5 star service is really like. The entrance of the hotel is very luxurious and very welcoming. As always staff is very awesome and is always happy to help. The breakfast buffet is well stocked with a large amount of tasty breakfast items. The bar has a good selection of drinks. The pool is indoor and is very nice. There is a hot tub but it is very small. The fitness area is very good and has a lot of equipment. My room was very nice and cozy. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom is clean. Great hotel for a stay in Sydney.
Excellent. Excellent location great staff and service. Hotel has very good facilities very reasonably priced too.

Sheraton Grand Hyde Park. The Sydney Sheraton Grand Hyde Park is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The staff from downstairs meeting you at your car to checkin are there to help with a smile. The newly renovated rooms are absolutely beautiful my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend staying here.

Fabulous. We booked a 3 night stay following a cruise on RCI our favourite cruise line. We got a taxi from the port at about 10 am which was very well organised by the port authorities. The taxi ride was about 20 mins and cost Aus30We arrived at the hotel and found they were prepared to check us in early. checking in is usually about 2 pm. We paid to upgrade to a Hyde Park view and were in our room just before 1am. The room had generous proportions with large picture windows providing a lovely view over Hyde Park with St Mary ’s cathedral in the distance. The spacious bathroom had a large shower cubicle with a separate bath. There was a separate walk in wardrobe with personal safe. The HD TV was huge about 52 ” overlooking the king sized very comfortable bed. We booked a breakfast each day which was superb. The range and quality of the food and service was 5star and did n’t disappoint. The choices included provision for all food types and requirements Vegan Diabetic etc. Taking into account that we were staying during the development of the worldwide Covid 19 pandemic hand sanitizers were available on entry and exit too. Maybe they are there usually but obviously I thought I ’d point that out. The location of the hotel for shopping was unrivalled with major quality shopping outlets being within 20 m of the hotels rear entrance exit. We did a lot of walking and were able to easily get to the Opera House Royal Botanical Gardens Darling Harbour The Rocks retail area and Paddy ’s markets. Directly outside the main entrance there are numerous bus stops with a train station about 100 m away too. The free WiFi appears to be fast and covers all the hotel. On the roof there is a well equipped leisure area which includes a Gym Sauna and swimming pool. We did not use these facilities due to the virus outbreak but had a look at the pool which also had an outside terrace too. On leaving the hotel we checked out but were able to leave our luggage until later 5ish when we got a taxi from the hotel to the airport which cost Aus5 they are parked up ready for you which was great. We had a great stay and would definitely stay there again in the future.
